activities:
Sertifi provide an electronic signature solution that enables customers to electronically sign agreements.   Our customers access our service via an API or web interface.  To send a transactions, the sender must pass two pieces of information to Sertifi including the email address of the signer and the agreements to be signed.   
For authentication purposes, Sertifi collects the email address and IP address of the senders and signers.  The information is collected at the time of delivery and stored with Sertifi for a time period based on our customer requirements.  Sertifi collects this information to ensure delivery of the agreements and to authenticate the senders and signers.
contactoff1: 350 N LaSalle St, Suite 1020 Chicago, IL 60654
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Personal data that is collected is email address of the sender and signers which can be organizational, client or personal.
recoursemech: Sertifi conducts audits of its relevant privacy practices to ensure adherence to this Notice.  Sertifi will investigate and attempt to resolve complaints and disputes regarding processing and disclosure of Personal Information in accordance with the principles contained in this Notice. For complaints resolved internally, Sertifi’s remedy will be reasonable, and sufficient corrective action to resolve the complaint, including correcting any Personal Information, using Personal Information consistent with the Safe Harbor Principles, reversing or correcting the effects of noncompliance, and assuring that future processing of Personal Information will be in conformity with the Safe Harbor Privacy Principles. Complaints that cannot be resolved between Sertifi will be handled by European Data Protection Authorities (EU DPAs) and the Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner of Switzerland (FDPIC).
